name: Carne Asada
ingredients: 1.5 lbs flank steak or skirt steak
description: A flavorful and tender grilled carne asada recipe, perfect for tacos, burritos, or serving with rice and beans.
instructions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine garlic, lime juice, orange juice, olive oil, soy sauce, cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, black pepper, salt, and red pepper flakes.

Step 2: Place the flank or skirt steak into a large resealable bag or shallow dish and pour the marinade over the steak. Seal the bag or cover the dish and marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours.
Step 3: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Once hot, lightly oil the grill grates.

Step 4: Remove the steak from the marinade and place it on the grill. Grill for 4-6 minutes per side for medium-rare, or until the desired level of doneness is reached. Use a meat thermometer to ensure proper internal temperature (130°F for medium-rare).
Step 5: Remove the steak from the grill and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing against the grain.
Step 6: Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with your favorite sides or tacos.

name: Vegetable Soup
description: A hearty and healthy vegetable soup with a mix of carrots, celery, potatoes, and more. Perfect for a comforting meal.
instructions: Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic, cooking for about 5 minutes until softened.
Step 2: Add the sliced carrots, celery, and diced potato. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Step 3: Add the chopped zucchini, diced tomatoes (with juice), vegetable broth, bay leaf, and thyme. Stir to combine.
Step 4: Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Let it cook for about 45 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Step 5: Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. Add the spinach or kale and peas (if using), and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Step 6: Remove the bay leaf before serving. Serve hot with crusty bread if desired.

name: Banana Pancakes
description: Fluffy and sweet banana pancakes, perfect for breakfast or brunch. The bananas add natural sweetness and flavor.
instructions: Step 1: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, mashed bananas, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Step 3: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix – it’s okay if the batter is a bit lumpy.
Step 4: Heat a frying pan or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Step 5: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 6: Serve the pancakes with butter and maple syrup, and garnish with extra banana slices if desired.

name: BBQ Pork Ribs
description: Tender, smoky pork ribs coated in a homemade rub and smothered in BBQ sauce for a delicious grilled feast.
instructions: Step 1: Preheat your grill to medium-low heat (around 275°F / 135°C). If using an oven, preheat to 300°F (150°C).
Step 2: Remove the membrane from the back of the pork ribs by gently pulling it off with your fingers or a paper towel.

Step 3: In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, paprika, black pepper, salt, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, smoked paprika, ground mustard, and cayenne pepper to make the dry rub.
Step 4: Rub the seasoning mixture generously over both sides of the pork ribs.

Step 5: Place the ribs on the grill, bone-side down. Cover the grill and cook for 2-3 hours, maintaining a steady temperature, flipping the ribs every 45 minutes. If using an oven, place the ribs on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil, and bake for 2.5-3 hours.
Step 6: After the ribs have cooked through, brush them with your favorite BBQ sauce and cook for an additional 20-30 minutes, until the sauce is caramelized.
Step 7: Remove the ribs from the grill (or oven) and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
